Electoral Registration, Valuation for Rating and Council Tax Bands in Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire & Moray

The Grampian Assessor & Electoral Registration Officer (ERO) is responsible for valuing non-domestic properties for rating, allocating dwellings to council tax bands and maintaining the Electoral Register.

The Assessor & ERO is employed and funded by the Grampian Valuation Joint Board. The Board is a public body that exists to provide the local taxation service to the three councils within the Grampian area (Aberdeen City, Aberdeenshire and Moray). By agreement with these councils, the Board is also responsible for the appointment and funding of the Electoral Registration Officer.

Further information about the Assessor & ERO and his staff can be found on this site along with information on Electoral Registration, the Valuation Roll and Council Tax.

Quick links:

  • Checking the Register of Electors

Latest news and updates:

  • 11 February 2019

    Don’t miss the deadline to refresh your absent vote signature

    2,197 absent voters have not responded to an invitation to refresh their signature and keep their absent voting arrangements up to date. If you have received a reminder from us asking you to provide a fresh sample signature please complete the form and send it back so that we have it by Friday 15 February, otherwise your absent voting arrangements will be cancelled.  You will however still be entitled to vote in person at your polling station and may also make a fresh application for an absent vote at a later date if ...

    Read more

    Absent vote signature refresh

    Watch out for the signature refresh request arriving in your post – we are asking 26,407 electors who arranged to vote ...

    Read more

    15,000 Grampian citizens need to get registered to vote

    Every autumn we carry out a canvass of all households in Grampian and remove the names of people who have moved ...

  • 3 August 2018

    Household enquiry form reminders issued –

    We have had the best ever response to our household canvass and are very grateful to the 77,000 householders who have ...

  • 30 July 2018

    Nearly 80,000 Grampian households help save public funds

    A record-breaking 77,504 households in Grampian have responded using our automated response service within the first month of the annual household ...

    Read more

We are Cyber Essentials Plus certified

Cyber Essentials aims to help organisations implement basic levels of protection against cyber attack, demonstrating to their customers that they take cyber security seriously. The scheme is available at two levels:

  • Cyber Essentials – an independently verified self assessment. Organisations assess themselves against five basic security controls and a qualified assessor verifies the information provided.
  • Cyber Essentials PLUS – a higher level of assurance. A qualified and independent assessor examines the same five controls, testing that they work in practice by simulating basic hacking and phishing attacks.

The five basic controls within Cyber Essentials were chosen because, when properly implemented, they will help to protect against unskilled internet-based attackers using commodity capabilities – which are freely available on the internet.

Organisations that undertake Cyber Essentials are encouraged to recertify at least once a year and, where appropriate, progress their security.
